channel.title: Yongsan-gu on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Yongsan War Memorial, seeing Korea's last divided country - Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Scene of the reconstruction of Seoul's restoration of the armed forces displayed in the '6/25 War Room'

Yongsan War Memorial, seeing Korea's last divided country

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

On June 25, 1950, the dawn where everyone fell asleep before dawn. Gunshots echoed on the peaceful Korean Peninsula. The Korean War began when the North Korean army crossed the 38th parallel, which was the inter-Korean military demarcation line. The blood-sharing war between the Korean people continued with the casualties of the United States, the Soviet Union, and China until the July 1953 armistice. Even before enjoying the joy of escaping from the Japanese colonial rule. Introducing Yongsan's War Memorial, which records the history of the land half a century ago.

Remembrance Day and June, which embraced June 25, are the month of the Veterans' Day. Perhaps it is because of our ancestors who fought everything to protect the country that we can suffer from personal concerns such as dating, employment, and marriage. Before and after June 25th, how about remembering your ancestors for a few days and having a thankful heart? With that in mind, I visited the Yongsan War Memorial.

The history of the war recorded vividly at a glance
Before entering the war memorial, the giant pagoda at the front door and the statue of the patriotic army greet visitors.
Seoul Yongsan War Memorial
It was a picture of the time of the war, with vivid expressions and gestures from armed soldiers at the front to the youngest child at the back.
Seoul Yongsan War Memorial
On the left is the “Brother's Prize,” which symbolizes a divided country divided into South and North. Why did brothers with the same mother be divided into South Korean and North Korean forces and aimed at each other? I am sorry for the appearance of my younger brother who is digging into my brother's arms. After passing through the large square, we enter the interior of the war memorial.
The statue of the patriotic army
Let's start our full-scale war memorial tour. In order to properly examine the War Memorial, which consists of a total of three floors, a brochure is essential. When visiting the War History Room on the 1st floor and the 6/25 War Room on the 2nd floor, it is also very helpful to listen to the cultural narrator accompanying you four times a day.
2nd floor starting point for visiting the War Memorial
On the 2nd floor, where the entrance to the War Memorial Hall is displayed, the 'Hospital Memorial Room' honors and commemorates the ancestors who devoted their lives for their homeland, and '6 · 25', which displays all the processes of the Korean War from the North Korean invasion to the Armistice Agreement in an easy-to-understand manner. There is a War Room I and II. After that, you can look back on the 3rd floor, ‘The UN Room’, ‘The Donation Room’, the ‘Overseas Deployment Room’, and the ‘Army Development Room’. The history of war on the Korean Peninsula can be seen at a glance in the “war history” on the first floor.
Adding a description of the cultural commentator gives you a chance to see
A bloody ideological battle between the same peoples, the Korean War
On August 15, 1945, World War II war criminal Japan surrendered. This ended the war and the Korean Empire was able to escape the 36-year Japanese occupation period.
The site of the excavation of the remains of the Korean War was recreated.
The joy of regaining the country for a while, despite the independence movement in the meantime, the independence by Japanese ruin pushes the Korean Peninsula into another crisis. Despite the desire for 'self-independence and sovereignty', the Korean Peninsula is divided into south and north, where the waist is cut around the 38th parallel.
Weapons used during the war
In 1948, President Syngman Rhee was elected the first President of the Republic of Korea. As an independence activist, he was a thorough anti-communist and campaigned for reunification. In North Korea, there was Kim Il-sung, who had the Soviet Union on his back.
Our air force picked up the bomb and dropped it through the window.
In this way, even before the Korean peninsula enjoyed the joy of independence, the South had a democratic and communist (divided into) Han, but had a separate national system with two ideologies.
Detonating the Han River Railway Bridge to prevent North Korean troops
One day when the big and small fights between South and North continued around the 38th parallel, the dawn of June 25, 1950, North Korea went on a surprise attack before dawn. After that, the support of the Soviet Union was promised. South Korea, which lacks proper military training and equipment, is faced with helplessness. I broke the Hangang bridge and earned time, but it was pushed to the Nakdong River defense line. However, General MacArthur's Incheon Landing Operation (September 15, 1950) returned to Seoul in three months and recaptured Pyongyang and quickly advanced to the Yalu River.
President Syngman Rhee commanded North Korea with a desire for reunification
After the unification, the ROK military forces are pushed back to the south with the intervention of the Chinese army. It is a 1 · 4 retreat. At this time, the place where the South Korean troops, UN forces and North Korean refugees escaped was the Hungnam Wharf of Hamheung. In the movie <International Market>, this is where the main character lost his father and younger sister. The bloody war on the Korean Peninsula continued until the armistice was reached in July 1953. Even now, we are in a truce.
4D realistic video room where you can experience the time when you went to the evacuation route
While listening to the explanation of the commentator, you will see the “6/25 War Room I · II Hall”. It reproduces the appearance of the war and adds realism. From the background of the North Korean military invasion to the war and the Armistice Agreement, the process is clearly displayed. In particular, the 'Incheon Landing Operation 4D Experience Hall (7 minutes of screening time, 15 people watching once)' and 4D Realistic Video Room (9 minutes of screening time, 40 people watching once) 'show severe weather through 4D video, vibration, and blizzard effects. It is popular because you can experience the difficult evacuation process yourself.
Battle scene of white horse highland
Even if you look at the center of the '6/25 War Room', the hour of commentary is over 1 hour. After inspecting the 3rd floor and the donation room where you can meet the United Nations veterans, you will be transferred to the ROK military development room and overseas deployment room. It is no longer unfamiliar to say ‘Hochon’ I bow my head to the efforts of the ancestors who fought to protect the land. Learning about the history of this land is a bonus.
Turtle ship displayed outside the war history room on the 1st floor of the War Memorial
If you visited the War Memorial Hall with your children, it would be a good idea to go to the Children's Museum after visiting the 6/25 War Room. About a day in June, how about visiting the war memorial, thinking about the country?
A war history room displaying military relics of this land
TIP. War memorial
29 Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul War Memorial Hall / 02-709-3139 / 9:30 a.m. ~ 6 p.m. (Closed on Mondays, closed the day after the last holiday if Monday is a holiday included) / Free of charge for permanent exhibition / 3000 won until 2 hours for a small car 1,000 won per 30 minutes)
https://www.warmemo.or.kr/front/main.do
TIP. War Memorial Children's Museum

Daily admission is limited to the number of admissions per visit, and reservations are made for 60% of online reservations and 40% on the same day (first-come, first-served basis). 15 or more advance reservations required. 9:30 a.m. ~ 6 p.m. (Closed on Mondays, closed on the day following the last holiday if Monday is a holiday included) / Free admission / 02-709-3200

https://www.warmemo.or.kr/kids/main.do

Travel info

1. Nearby restaurants

Munbae Dongyuk knife: Yukkal (Yukgaejang + Kalguksu) / Baekbeom-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-713-6204

Center: Hand-made kalguksu with clams / Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-2235-0707
Waffle House: Strawberry Bingsu, Waffle / Cheongpa-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-711-2649
Kachinae style: 쫄 myeon sundubu, kimchi fried rice / Cheongpa-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-715-0806


2. Accommodation

Gayara Tree Hotel: Hangang-daero, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-798-5101
Crown Tourist Hotel: Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu, Seoul / 02-797-4111

www.hotelcrown.co.kr

item.title: Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea - Is this liberation village? Casablanca, Storage Book & Film, Sofiti
item.description:
Enjoy a hearty meal at Casablanca

Is this liberation village? Casablanca, Storage Book & Film, Sofiti

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

Liberation Village, an exotic building with old buildings and old signs. If you walk a little further on this unfamiliar and familiar street, you will be waiting for Seoul in the 1960s, with a building on a steep hill. In the spring when the rain falls, I left for the pleasure of the Liberation Village.
Liberation Village, the name of the overseas Koreans who returned to their homeland in 1945 and the displaced people. No matter how you listen, this strange neighborhood is emerging as a hot street. Introducing the hot place of Haebangchon, where you can enjoy the charms different from Itaewon and Gyeongridangil, already filled with the smell of 2000s.
Is this liberation village? Morocco? Casablanca
In small spaces, people are gathering together. It's mostly foreigners too. Even the orderer is a charming foreigner with bushy beards, so it's easy to wonder if it's overseas. If you look back and outside, this is a liberation village.
Casablanca can always see foreigners loyal
Casablanca, run by two brothers from Morocco, has a taste of Moroccan that is so good that Daniel Tudor, author of 'A Country Who Lost Miracles, Lost Joy', said, 'It's much better than Itaewon's expensive food.' . Most of the ingredients and condiments used for the large and thick sandwiches for the price are real exhaust through their hands. We hope that foreigners can taste their hometown at an affordable price.
Figure of foreigner couple waiting for ordered menu
The simple yet generous ingredients in the savory, hot baguette are a good example of Morocco's intense and addictive exotic flavor. Shrimp sandwiches with Moroccan sauce and Harry's Hot Sauce are the most popular dishes! The Moroccan Chicken Sandwich, with its curry-flavored chicken and vegetables, is also available.
A simple yet rich sandwich from Casablanca's main menu
In addition, soup made from lentil beans, which are said to be good for health, and `` Makuda '', a potato croquette that is also enjoyed as a street food in Morocco, is also an unusual menu.
Lentil Soup Known as Health Food by Lee Hyo Ri
If you want a limited edition book, 'Storage Book & Film'
If exotic restaurants tempt you at the beginning of the liberation village, the world of those who are quietly living their lives without signboards over the steep hillsides raises questions. Among them, 'Storage Book & Film', which is located near the three-way intersection of emerging churches, is an independent bookstore that started with the sale of film cameras and has now expanded to the distribution of independent publications.
The shop is simple but there are a lot of treasures to see.
In addition to independent publications, the camera is based on various kinds of photo books. Independent magazine 'Walkjin' is a collection of photographs published by bookstore owners. Season 1, the last greeting with 22 episodes, consisted of 45-60 photographs of a city captured by one person. Is filling. If you want to participate, you can knock on the bookstore door.
A look at Storage Book & Film on a slope
In addition, there are various lectures related to publishing such as InDesign, book binding, and calligraphy. In particular, the four-week photo book making and independent publishing courses are solid enough to be consistently found by people.
Visitors who touch books for a long time and find their own books
Soapy genie where soap becomes work
In the past, there are various types of studios that look like hidden paintings between the alleys. Two years ago, when you open the door of the soap studio Sopizini, you will be greeted by the fragrances that make your sense of smell happy and the colors of the eyes strong.
Cutely decorated studio is cozy
The master's job is an English teacher. Soap making, a long-time hobby, became another happiness that can't be removed from life after five years since it started selling in flea markets. Not only the fragrance and color, but also the potency of each soap, her efforts go all the way to shine even more.
Emotional handmade soaps that can only be found in Sopigini
Like the British handmade cosmetics brand, Rush, we hope to become Korea's leading handmade soap brand beyond Haebangchon.
Showcase outside the studio
It is a warm spring day to hold hands with your loved ones. How about leaving your first outing with a liberation village where your senses as well as your eyes, nose and mouth are happy?
Sofignini owner making soap
Travel info

Casablanca
-Address: 33 Sinheung-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul
Inquiries: 02-797-8367

Storage Book & Film
-Address: 115-1, Sinheung-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul

http://www.storagebookandfilm.com/shop/main/index.php

SOAPY GENIE

item.title: Hannam-dong Back Alley Tour
item.description:
Hannam-dong Back Alley Travel Map

Hannam-dong Back Alley Tour

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

'Usadan-ro 10-gil', once located in Itaewon, once called the Liberation Village, has once again attracted the attention of the world. On the last Saturday of every month, we will visit the 10th Usadan-ro, Hannam-dong, a “warm town” in Seoul, which is being transformed into a forward base for small-business start-up as well as a space for artistic creation for young people.

Hansa-dong's Usadan-ro 10-gil, a young base for convergence and convergence of youth
Hansa-dong's Usadan-ro is less than 900 meters from Bogwang Elementary School to Cheongseok Super. Exit No. 3 of Itaewon Station (Line 6) and go up 100 meters to the '119 Safety Center' alley. Looking up from here, you can see two towers towering towards the sky. 'Seoul Central Masjid'. In front of the main entrance to the Islamic Masjid, the road that stretches in the direction of the Han River is Usadan.
Daytime in the Islamic Central Member of Seoul
If there were a lot of pear trees and it was called 'Itaewon (梨 泰 院)', 'Usadan-ro' came from the record that the altar 'Usadan' was built here for the rain festival during Taejong, Joseon Dynasty. Usadan-ro 10-gil is a favorite place for photographers because of the interruption of the redevelopment project. Let's take a look at what's going on.
Seoul Islamic Central Masquerade Night
It's hard to find an alley where Shingu is harmonious, like Usadan-ro 10-gil from Seoul.
Hanjin Barber Shop
From old-fashioned barbershops that use firewood as fuel, to radio stations, rice cakes, Pakistani and Turkish restaurants, the traditional market blends together, and the guest house, as well as a jewelry design shop using the latest technology.
50-year-old Barber Chair at Hanjin Barber Shop
Walking along this road, there are so many foreigners that I wonder if there are more foreigners than Koreans.
Kebab restaurant transformed in mutt PC room
Not only the geographical features of Itaewon and Islam mosques, but also because of the old houses, the rent is cheap and the language and living environment are convenient.
Kebab restaurant transformed in mutt PC room
Itaewon's famous staircase and “Come in store”
Here is a community that drives young desires and change. The young cultural artists 'Usadandan (雩 祀 壇 團)' combines interesting cultural contents and business with the young people traders. Since 2012, young people who live in the area and have business spaces such as workshops have been working together to create local culture and revitalize their business.
Stairs next to the central Islamic mosque where the staircase was held
The most representative business is the free market called 'stair leader'. The staircase, which started on 63 steps next to a mosque last spring, has only 30 to 40 participants, but now it has become one of the representative flea markets in Seoul.
Stairs next to the central Islamic mosque where the staircase was held
The stairs are open from 12 am to 6 am on the last Saturday of every month.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
It was originally held on 63 steps, less than 3 meters wide. Sellers can be assigned three stairs to sell.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
However, for the safety and convenience of many visitors to the stairs, the place is moved to 'Usadan-ro 10-gil'.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
The 'coming shops' with the catch phrase 'Come in because it's hot' on both sides of the street, and the temporary seller table installed in front of it, replace the stairs.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
One of the popular programs of 'Staircase-In Come' is 'Tongtong Tour', which explores local culture.
Plump Tour
You will wander through the alley for two hours and hear interesting stories about the history and culture of the area.
Tattoo drawing
The tour program, which starts at the central mosque and ends at the supermarket, is conducted by young local residents.
Seller's homemade basil pesto
As with any flea market, the most popular places are the gourmet foods, tattoo houses, and portrait shops, where you can draw a portrait in 10 seconds for 10 won.
Portrait that draws in 10 seconds for 10 won
Usadan-ro 10-gil, Itaewon, transforming into an artist studio and cultural spot
There are a growing number of shops on Usadan-gil, with unique attractions run by young Soho entrepreneurs and artists.
Suine's Snack Store Famous for Spicy Chicken Feet
In particular, the Potato House, which is run by youth traders, sells the popular concept of Potato and Beer.
A young merchant who is good at Sabah
In addition to trendy foods such as meals and snacks for lunch and dinner in the evenings, Sooky's Snack Shop, a spicy chicken restaurant popular with famous celebrities, is whether it's a snack bar or a bar. It's weird.
Sophisticated Yukgaejang
Chicken shops such as Song Elim Chicken, which are commonly found in the traditional world of 'Eating My World', offer chefs' menus that change every day.
Deep-fried brown chicken
There are a variety of cafes on Usadan-gil.
coffee
There are cafes in various forms, ranging from “today's opening” to “entropy” reminiscent of the laws of physics and “champs” reminiscent of boxing films.
Entropy
Champ is a roasting café operated by three brothers and made freshly roasted coffee beans to become a favorite coffee shop not only for the elderly, but also for young people. Down. 10 minutes patiently wait.
Champ Coffee
'It would have opened today' is a free-spirited cafe that the owner wants to open, but now it is open every day except Sundays.
I would have opened today
There are designer jewelery shops on both sides of the street, opened by young people with both dexterity and sense.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
Young designers and makers work together to produce and display jewelry, bags, and accessories, which are made by giving off artistic artists.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
Typical shops include MK Leather Work (handmade leather bracelet), 'World I live' (handmade metal workshop), 'Mind Mine' (design jewelry), 'Luciente' (homemade jewelry), Ampersand (classic leather accessory), ' Thy '(leather wallet, wooden glasses, watch),' The 7th Heaven '(silverwork),' J & J Works' (jeans recycling accessory), and Xia's emotional doll.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
They create beautiful props that bring youth and run experience classes.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
In addition, 'WORKS', which commissions and sells works produced by independent designers, 'Soul Ink', which combines an art tattoo shop and a graffiti exhibition hall, 'Kiss Gallery' with three works and a bench for viewing outside the window, Don't forget 'Art Recipe'.
Kiss pics
HAUS, a guest house for travelers, not only accepts guests in three rooms with bunk beds, but also serves as a local tourist information center and love room.
Guest House Haus
Tiger House has a well-viewed guest house famous for its bare tacos and polar beer.
Tiger House
Usadan-ro 10-gil ending at Dokkaebi Market and Supermarket
Entering the 'Dokkaebi Market', the road is divided into two parts. On the right side is the 'Cheongseok Super', the end of 10 roads in Usadan-ro. Follow the road on your left to 'Supermarket'. 'Supermarket' is a three-story building that is used as a café, small gatherings, parties, and dining venues by renovating an existing building.
Supermarket cafe
'Dokkaebi market' is a traditional market. When the crackdown of the ward office comes, it avoids it like a goblin.
Han River catches a glance at rooftop table

The characteristic of the shops that entered Usadanro is the creative space that made the old buildings with minimal remodeling. So some shops use old signs to confuse visitors. Nevertheless, due to the affection and passion of young artists and entrepreneurs, Usadan Street, which can turn into an unsafe crime alley, is transformed into an art creative street, and the streets of young people representing Seoul following Hongdae, Garosu-gil, etc. It is transformed into.

Dokebi Market
P.S.

On the late evening of Wednesday, four days after the staircase-incoming ceremony was held, I went back to the street. It's nine o'clock, and people are cut off and most shops are closed. English phrases written on the glass window reflecting the appearance of a few young people busy preparing to open a design office called “P.S.” touch the chest. “People all have names. Sometimes, things name people. We name things that already have names. Now, this could be the only name. ” “A person has a name, and sometimes things name a person. Even when there is a name for things, people call it again. ” In addition, I remember the title of poet Lee Kyung-ok's collection of poetry `` Road makes a way by walking. '' I wonder if we should walk on Usadan Road and call out its name to create the Usadan Street that young people dream of. And wishes.

Travel info

Usadan-ro 10-gil
Location: Usadan-ro 10-gil, Yongsan-gu, Seoul-From Islamic Temple (39) to Hannam-dong Dokkebi Market
Stairway Information: March to October, Last Saturday of every month from 12:00 to 6:00 pm
Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/wosadan


1. Nearby restaurants

The Baker's Table: 244-1, Noksapyeong-daero, Yongsan-gu / 070-7717-3501

Don Charley: 34, Hoemok-ro, Yongsan-gu / 070-8154-4475
